|seats1_title = 2nd Republic Parliament |seats1 = 29 seats |seats2_title =
|seats2 = |symbol = |website = |footnotes = }} The 'National Alliance of
Liberals (NAL)' was a political party in Ghana during the Second Republic (1969-
1972). In elections held on 29 August 1969, the NAL won 29 out of 140 seats in
the National Assembly.

Komla Agbeli Gbedemah was the founder and leader of the party.
